problem_text:
The holomorph Hol(G) of a group G can be defined as the normalizer of the subgroup of left translations in the group of all permutations of the set G. The multiple holomorph NHol(G) of G is the normalizer of the holomorph. Set T(G) = NHol(G)/Hol(G).
a) Is there a centerless group G for which T(G) is not an elementary abelian 2-group?
b) Is there a finite centerless group G for which T(G) is not an elementary abelian 2-group?
c) (A. Caranti). Is there a finite p-group G for which the order of T(G) has a prime divisor not dividing (p − 1)p?
C. Tsang
